Posts.Content: Thanks Lesley your life sounds like mine as I do Husband’s accounts too and care for elderly parents on top of everything else. When MRI and CT came back clear I had to remind hubby that I still had cancer and was facing surgery and radiotherapy! He has just thrown himself into getting even more work and spends evenings taking calls . I’ve 2 grown up children at home and do a lot for them, lunches and washing as I’m seen as not having a proper job since I retired from midwifery a few years ago ( stressed) . I know it’s my fault but it’s the carer in me.  I take the dog on long country walks at the moment as it’s my time to think and the scenery gives me a boost as I love nature. It’s nice to know people in a similar situation as I don’t think you can truly empathise unless you have been there, no matter how much you love the person.  Ta x
Posts.Title: I’ve been lurking.....

Posts.Content: I’ve been lurking around reading all your helpful posts since the end of February when I got my diagnosis and have gone through the usual testing MRI and CT .  I’m sort of embarrassed to say I’m stressed/struggling as you have all had difficult times. I’m booked for lumpectomy (in armpit) and sentinel node biopsy on the 4 April and the waiting is so hard . Life is just plodding on but inside I’m screaming “I’ve got f@@@ing cancer!” And I feel so alone even when the house is full. Lots of other family things going on too, daughter just been dumped 4 weeks before having baby, other daughter having to sort childcare as I look after granddaughter. I feel like I’ve still got to support them but being selfish expecting something back.  So I’m posting on here before I explode or melt due to the extreme hot flushes I’m now getting!  Thanks for being there over the last few weeks and hope you will hold my hand on the 4th April. Xx
Posts.Title: I’ve been lurking.....

Posts.Content: Im nearly at my first year anniversary and over the last 6 months I’ve lost 2 toenails, gained nearly a stone and today the Opitician tells me I’m developing a cataract possibly related to the Tamoxifen.Im finding this difficult as I’ve just buried my mom , have to look after my dad who lives 40 miles away and my daughter is 20 weeks pregnant with a complicated pregnancy.  Ive got to cope as everyone expects me to just get on with it but I’m falling apart inside and no one sees this . I don’t sleep well and read the Awake thread every day!I feel bad for moaning as I got away quite easy( read my profile) but I feel no one but other Macmillan’s ( I don’t like the term survivor) understand. ta for being there . X
Posts.Title: Breast cancer the gift that keeps giving!

Posts.Content: Thank you all . I’ll look for the Birmingham meet up dates as I’m in Staffordshire.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer the gift that keeps giving!

Posts.Content: Hi, is it definitely a haematoma or isn’t it a seroma ? Seroma are very common following SND and feel like a water balloon under the skin . Get it checked out with the breast care nurse as it may need draining if painful.  I had a seroma after the same surgery, it came up by day 5 and ended up being drained a couple of times before developing a leak of its own. I’m now about 9 weeks post op and all has healed. It was very painful and I ended up in A and E one weekend being given Oramorph and having it drained.  I had cocodamol And ibuprofen for pain and also trammadol at night for a short time as it was so bad . ( Thanet can be addicting so be careful)  I found wrapping a large bandage around my chest, shoulder and armpit tightly helped a bit . I was quite miserable but it does get better eventually.  Get seen by your breast care nurse for advice .  Sending a virtual hug. Xx
Posts.Title: Slow recovery from WLE and SNB

Posts.Content: Hi Salley, I had a large seroma following Lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy in my axilla following surgery on the 4 April.I had it drained a couple of times and ended up in A+E on one occasion due to the pain where I was given Oramorph which helped for an hour or so .  My seroma then developed a leak so had to wear a dressing which had to be changed a couple of times a day for about a week and a half. It’s now resolving and feels like a sausage in my armpit!  For pain relief I had Co-codamol 30/500 (paracetamol and codiene)prescribed by gp . I also had neurofen which I took and when it was really tense I had some Trammadol at night .  I found that it was more comfy if I applied pressure to it so I got a big crepe bandage and bound around the armpit, chest and shoulder.  I was totally miserable as even with the drugs it was uncomfortable. I’m feeling much better now so it does resolve. Go to Gp and got something stronger than paracetamol to take with the neurofen.  Xx
Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: Hi salley I found once my seroma stopped draining the open bit soon healed up. Although I’m 7 weeks post op my armpit is still uncomfortable at times but much improved from when the seroma was active. Honestly it does get better and less painful, try and remember that a good chunk of flesh has been removed and all the underlying tissues have to heal too . I’ve just had a bit of my scar reopen with a bit of infection but within a week it’s closing up .  It will heal and you will get your chemo/ radiotherapy. If you search “seroma sisters” there is an old thread where one lady had hers drained 33 times!  I know it’s frustrating, I’ve been there .  Sending you a virtual hug. Xx

Posts.Title: Seroma/ pain

Posts.Content: No I just swapped one for the other once I’d received the new prescription. I’ve had about 13 days of tamoxifen so far and hands about 80% improvement but the hot flushes bad at night. I can cope with the flushes as they are mostly at night.
Posts.Title: Has anyone stopped taking letrozole and switched to other aromatase...

Posts.Content: I’d been on Anastrozole for 6 months and have had excruciating hand pains, being unable to even tear the loo roll in the morning without crying. I mentioned it to the breast care practitioner / nurse who changed my prescription to Tamoxifen. This was miraculous as the hand pain went straight away although the hot flushes are a bit worse. swings and roundabouts!
Posts.Title: Has anyone stopped taking letrozole and switched to other aromatase...
